intro: Pfaffia spicata var. pretensis, commonly known as the Pretoria arrowroot, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Marantaceae and is characterized by its erect, slender stems and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in inflorescences, which are typically borne on the upper parts of the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or grassland areas. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been used traditionally in some African cultures for its purported medicinal properties.
